alert.note: Alert for Northern Ware (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN BRANTLEY...EAST CENTRAL WARE AND NORTHWESTERN CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boggy Bay, or 8 miles south of Waycross. A strong thunderstorm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, pea size hail, and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Fort Mudge, Braganza, and Boggy Bay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
